p: Regarding anti-inflammatory potential, the effects of a chloroform extract of Condea albida (syn. Hyptis albida) on inflammatory responses in mouse lipopolysaccharide (LPS) induced peritoneal macrophages were evaluated. The results demonstrated that the extract was able in inhibit LPS-induced production of TNF-α and interleukin-6, signaling molecules in the inflammatory cascade ( Sánchez Miranda et al., 2013). Besides, the essential oil of Cantinoa americana (syn. Hyptis spicigera), whose main compounds were α-pinene ( 238), sabinene ( 246) and β-caryophyllene ( 262), was tested. Approximately 75% of lipoxigenase inhibition was achieved in the treatment with this oil (8 mg/mL) ( Bayala et al., 2014).
